page.title: 02FARMING
page.content: The soil does not lend itself to highly mechanised farming - due to the stone content - so agriculture remains{traditional.}A number of cattle are reared so grass is important for grazing and conservation as hay and silage.Turnips and swedes provide valuable winter fodder and a good weed and disease break crop. {Cash crops}are mostly cereals-wheat, barley and oats- with potatoes grown in selected fields and usually lifted by hand employing local labour. The latest cash crops, also break crops, are autumn sown oil seed rape,(the seeds of which are crushed to produce 40% of a vegetable oil) and spring sown peas which have a high protein content for human and animal use. These last two crops are heavily subsidised by the E.E.C. and not subject to volatile world prices.
